criterion: Provides a clear and concise explanation of why diarrhea might persist despite treatment.
Mentions the possibility of an underlying condition or infection that needs medical attention.
Asks the user about their overall health and any additional symptoms.
Advises the user to continue using the oral rehydration solution and bland diet.
Falsely suggests that diarrhea is a normal part of the digestive process and doesn't need medical attention.
Tells the user to stop using the oral rehydration solution and bland diet.
Asks the user to seek medical attention immediately, without considering their specific situation.
Provides an overly complicated or technical explanation of diarrhea.
Mentions that diarrhea is a sign of a serious underlying condition and the user should see a doctor immediately.
Asks the user to provide more information about their diet and lifestyle before providing advice.
